alert.note: Alert for Lower Jefferson; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 10:28AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL ST. BERNARD, SOUTHWESTERN ORLEANS AND NORTH CENTRAL JEFFERSON PARISHES THROUGH 1115 AM CDT... At 1026 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing tropical funnel cloud over land and possibly a waterspout over Lake Pontchartrain near Jefferson, or near Metairie. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Waterspouts and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Marrero, Harvey, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Chalmette, Metairie, Jefferson, Gretna, Westwego, Woodmere, Terrytown, Bridge City, Estelle, Arabi, and Lakefront Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 229 and 246. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Lower Jefferson; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans
